info.name: 2_SmartStorage
info.description:
Management of HPE Smart Storage: view, create, delete disks and logical drives.

This collection can only be used against HPE Gen10 servers only.

This collection has been used to write the [Storage management with Redfish](https://developer.hpe.com/blog/storage-management-with-redfish) article.

[Published](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/3625509/RzfmESXR)

request.description: Retrieves the list of HPE Smart Array Controllers present in the remote server.
Retrieves the properties of Array Controller 0. Edit accordingly to retrieve the properties of another Array Controller

exec: // Make sure we'll work on a suitable response.
// Extract PostState and SmartArrayDiscovery values from the response.
// Print keys and corresponding values on the Postman Console.

request.description:
Retrieves the Computer System properties and print PostState and SmartArrayDiscovery values in environment variables and in the Postman Console using the `test` Postman facility.

As explained in the [Master the Redfish Server States](https://developer.hpe.com/blog/master-the-redfish-server-states-to-improve-your-monitoring-and-manageme) blog, it is important to know the server state as well as other states like the SmartArrayDiscovery state before sending Redfish requests.

As an example, an error will be returned when querying the Smart Array controller when it is in the `Busy` state.

response.name: States & Device Discovery

request.description: Retrieves the list of disk drives managed by Array Controller 0. Edit accordingly to retrieve the disk of another controller.
Retrieves the Smart Storage current configuraion properties.
Retrieves the Settings properties that will become effective after next reboot.
Retrieves the list of non HPE storage, if any.

Create a RAID1 logical drive with a spare drive. 

Edit accordingly to your environment.
Create from scratch, after complete cleanup.
